name: hair dryer production | hair dryer | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21643/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average hair dryer which is approximately 0.89 kg in mass and has a rating of 2000 W. It has the envisaged lifetime of 3 years and is manufactured in Southeast Asia. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average hair dryer are taken from Ashby 2009. The figure on the annual world production volume (85000000 units) is assumed to equate to the world demand for hair dryers as estimated by Panasonic IR Day 2012. 

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average hair dryer. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average hairdryer. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Southeast Asia.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Southeast Asia.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The figure on the annual world production volume (85000000 units) is assumed to equate to the world demand for hair dryers as estimated by Panasonic IR Day 2012.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Ashby 2009. Data on the annual production volume are assumed to equate to the world demand for hair dryers as estimated by Panasonic IR Day 2012. Sources: Ashby, M.F., 2009. Materials and the Environment. Eco-informed material choice. Elsevier, Oxford, 2009. Panasonic IR Day 2012. Appliances company business strategy. 23 May 2012. Available from: https://www.panasonic.com/global/corporate/ir/pdf/irday_es.pdf (Accessed 12 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Used here in place of infrastructure based on the amount of the largest contributor to the final product mass (plastics). This is an estimated value. According to the technology comment of the dataset 'Plastic processing factory construction, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018], the life time of the tanks is assumed to be 50 years and the annual production is 27000 t/a. Thus, the estimated lifetime output of the factory is 27000 x 50 = 1350000. As the hair dryer mass is 0.89 kg, then the number of hair dryers produced during the lifetime of the factory is 1350000 / 0.00089 = 1516853933 units. The calculation of the infrastructure is therefore 1/life time capacity = 1/1516853933 unit.
